title: Hybrid Learning Design Workshop for Working Professionals: Boundary Crossing Theory-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic adult education theory and job-related social sector knowledge
context.additional_context: Program to strengthen competencies in designing social studies courses for small groups of working professionals, conducted in non-real-time LMS environments assuming smartphone-based learning

learning_goals: Learners can explain three core design principles for hybrid learning environments (school-workplace integration)
Learners can establish context-specific learning intervention strategies by applying boundary crossing theory to real-world work contexts
Learners can design smartphone-compatible hybrid learning modules using evidence-based instructional design principles

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
